title: priming sugar calculator 5 gallons | Professional, Accessible Tool

formulas.title: Formula (extracted LaTeX)
formulas.latex: k_{\mathrm{sugar}} = \begin{cases} 3.82 & \text{for sucrose (table sugar)}\\ 4.42 & \text{for dextrose monohydrate (corn sugar)}\\ 4.02 & \text{for dextrose anhydrous (glucose)}\\ 6.40 & \text{for dry malt extract (DME, light, approx.)} \end{cases}
formulas.raw: k_{\mathrm{sugar}} = \begin{cases} 3.82 & \text{for sucrose (table sugar)}\\ 4.42 & \text{for dextrose monohydrate (corn sugar)}\\ 4.02 & \text{for dextrose anhydrous (glucose)}\\ 6.40 & \text{for dry malt extract (DME, light, approx.)} \end{cases}

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: For beer temperature T in °F, residual dissolved CO₂ (volumes) is approximated by: \[ V_{\mathrm{res}}(T_{°F}) = 3.0378 - 0.050062\,T + 0.00026555\,T^{2} \] Convert Celsius to Fahrenheit before applying the formula: \[ T_{°F} = \frac{9}{5}T_{°C} + 32 \] Total priming sugar mass (in grams) is: \[ m_{\mathrm{sugar}} = \bigl(V_{\mathrm{target}} - V_{\mathrm{res}}\bigr)\times V_{\mathrm{beer\_L}}\times k_{\mathrm{sugar}} \] where: \[ V_{\mathrm{beer\_L}} = \text{batch volume in liters} \] \[ k_{\mathrm{sugar}} = \begin{cases} 3.82 & \text{for sucrose (table sugar)}\\ 4.42 & \text{for dextrose monohydrate (corn sugar)}\\ 4.02 & \text{for dextrose anhydrous (glucose)}\\ 6.40 & \text{for dry malt extract (DME, light, approx.)} \end{cases} \]
